1.text: Now concerning the collection for the saints, as I gave order to the churches of Galatia, so also do ye.

2.text: Upon the first day of the week let each one of you lay by him in store, as he may prosper, that no collections be made when I come.

3.text: And when I arrive, whomsoever ye shall approve by letters, them will I send to carry your bounty unto Jerusalem:

4.text: and if it be meet for me to go also, they shall go with me.

5.text: But I will come unto you, when I shall have passed through Macedonia; for I do pass through Macedonia;

6.text: but with you it may be that I shall abide, or even winter, that ye may set me forward on my journey whithersoever I go.

7.text: For I do not wish to see you now by the way; for I hope to tarry a while with you, if the Lord permit.

8.text: But I will tarry at Ephesus until Pentecost;

9.text: for a great door and effectual is opened unto me, and there are many adversaries.

10.text: Now if Timothy come, see that he be with you without fear; for he worketh the work of the Lord, as I also do:

11.text: let no man therefore despise him. But set him forward on his journey in peace, that he may come unto me: for I expect him with the brethren.

12.text: But as touching Apollos the brother, I besought him much to come unto you with the brethren: and it was not at all his will to come now; but he will come when he shall have opportunity.

13.text: Watch ye, stand fast in the faith, quit you like men, be strong.

14.text: Let all that ye do be done in love.

15.text: Now I beseech you, brethren (ye know the house of Stephanas, that it is the firstfruits of Achaia, and that they have set themselves to minister unto the saints),

16.text: that ye also be in subjection unto such, and to every one that helpeth in the work and laboureth.

17.text: And I rejoice at the coming of Stephanas and Fortunatus and Achaicus: for that which was lacking on your part they supplied.

18.text: For they refreshed my spirit and yours: acknowledge ye therefore them that are such.

19.text: The churches of Asia salute you. Aquila and Prisca salute you much in the Lord, with the church that is in their house.

20.text: All the brethren salute you. Salute one another with a holy kiss.

21.text: The salutation of me Paul with mine own hand.

22.text: If any man loveth not the Lord, let him be anathema. Maranatha.

23.text: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with you.

24.text: My love be with you all in Christ Jesus. Amen.
